content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Consists of two stone‐furnace units (located at approximately (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0)) each paired with burner‑inserters and wooden chests. These setups feed raw materials into the furnaces and collect the smelted outputs.

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Consists of a burner‑mining drill positioned at (–15.0, –50.0) linked with a wooden chest (around (–13.5, –51.5)) and an integrated transport‐belt network that distributes the extracted ore.

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Consists of a boiler at (8.0, 20.5) and multiple steam engines located at positions such as (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5). An extra steam engine remains unplaced due to severe congestion both in the boiler’s connection zone and in the adjacent buildable area near (8.5, 22.5).

• Automation Research Lab  
  Processes automation science packs but currently remains without power owing to unstable or missing electrical connectivity.

• Electrical and Transport Infrastructure  
  Encompasses an integrated network of electrical poles, transport belts (organized as BeltGroups), pipes (organized as PipeGroups), and associated connection groups that supply coherent connectivity between production areas and power/fluid systems. Note that spatial congestion is evident where multiple networks overlap.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement  
  – The extra steam engine consistently remains unplaceable due to overlapping burner‑inserters, misaligned transport belts, and limited clearance in the vicinity of the boiler at (8.0, 20.5) as well as the obstructed buildable area near (8.5, 22.5).  
  – Mitigation: Conduct a thorough manual inspection of the boiler and its connection interfaces. Remove or reposition obstructing entities, consider relocating the extra engine to a less congested zone, or modify the boiler layout to provide adequate spacing.

• Inadequate Fuel Supply in Burner Entities  
  – Numerous burner‑inserters and the burner‑mining drill report “NO_FUEL” or “WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS” statuses, interrupting their operation.  
  – Mitigation: Ensure that fuel is available consistently and that fuel sources are placed optimally adjacent to burner entities, minimizing delays in fuel extraction and transfer.

• Steam Engine Fluid and Electrical Connectivity  
  – Several steam engines report warnings such as “not connected to power network,” “no input liquid,” and “no fluid present in connections,” indicating faulty or obstructed interfacing with the power and fluid delivery networks.  
  – Mitigation: Reexamine all pipe and electrical connection points for each steam engine, ensuring unobstructed and properly aligned connections to both the fluid supply and the power network.

• Laboratory Power Deficiency  
  – The Automation Research Lab remains in a NO_POWER state, disrupting research operations.  
  – Mitigation: Reassess and adjust nearby wiring and electrical pole placements to secure a stable and reliable power connection to the lab.
